alert.note: Alert for Western Uinta Basin; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 12:59PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Duchesne and east central Summit Counties through 130 PM MDT... At 1258 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles south of Lonetree to 16 miles southeast of Mirror Lake. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kings Peak and Moon Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If on or near Moon Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Western Uinta Basin; Western Uinta Mountains
